JUDGES: András Sajó;David Thór Björgvinsson;Françoise Tulkens;Giorgio Malinverni;Paulo Pinto De Albuquerque
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , was a NORP national and lived in GPE .
On DATE the ORG was informed of his death on DATE and that his successors , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON GPE and Mr Erdinç PERSON stated their wish to pursue the application .

For practical reasons , Mr PERSON will continue to be called “ the applicant ” , although his successors are now to be regarded as such ( see ORG v. GPE [ ORG ] , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , ORG CARDINAL-VI , and also PERSON v. GPE , DATE , § CARDINAL , Reports of Judgments and Decisions CARDINAL ) .
On DATE the applicant underwent a hernia repair operation at ORG .

On DATE the applicant initiated legal proceedings against the doctor in charge and the hospital administration , claiming MONEY ( GPE ) in compensation . He alleged that he had lost CARDINAL of his earning capacity as a result of the medical negligence of the doctor . In particular , he contended that , following the surgery , a disc had become infected due to the doctor ’s malpractice .
On DATE Law No . DATE , according to which the jurisdictional limits imposed in appeals and rectification requests were increased , entered into force .

On DATE the ORG dismissed the case , relying on expert reports provided by ORG and ORG . It held that disc infection was a foreseeable complication of hernia operations , which had been treated appropriately in the applicant ’s case by his doctor . It concluded that the applicant ’s current health problems had not arisen from the surgery in question and therefore determined that no fault could be attributed to the doctor or the hospital .

On DATE ORG rejected the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal on the grounds that the amount in dispute was less than the minimum amount ( TRL CARDINAL ) required under the recently amended legislation for an appeal to be lodged with ORG . That being so , the applicant ’s request for leave to appeal had to be declared inadmissible in accordance with LAW as amended by LAW . DATE .

On DATE ORG rejected a request for rectification brought by the applicant , as the sum in dispute in the matter also did not exceed the required threshold ( TRL CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) for rectification pursuant to the aforementioned law .
